result.execSummary:
The defendant Chakula A Moore was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Penalties for Felonies-Class "H" Felony], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Same as probation conditions, exception is the condition time.

supervisions.notes: **08-23-16/Order commuting term of probation to three years

miscConds.notes: $19,936.00 to Walmart.  Agent can set up a payment plan.  To be paid first, before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.

Provide a biological speciment for DNA analysis if not already done so.
Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  To be paid after restitution has been satifised.
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.  To be paid during the term of probation.  If revoked, DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
Full time employment, or part time employment and school, or full time school.
No Contact Order with the WalMart retail store at 4140 W. Greenfield Avenue, Village of West Milwaukee.

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court will grant expungement if there are no further violations of the law and upon successful completion of the probatio sentence. Court finds that expungement would not be appropriate if significant and regular payments are not made to satisfy the restitution ordered.

Court will grant expungement if there are no further violations of the law and upon successful completion of the probation sentence. Court finds that expungement would not be appropriate if significant and reqular payments are not made to satisfy the restitution ordered.

records.addlTxt:
Order Commuting Term Of Probation And Amending Judgment Of Conviction - it is hereby ordered that the term of probation is commuted to three years - signed by the Court and filed.  Copies mailed to parties.
Clerk:  jms
Per Order of the Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Mark A. Sanders, Br. 28, for review. jbs
Letter from DOC seeking clarification of probationary term (excessive).
Printed in error. Duplicate.  NO CHANGES CORRECTION to assessments.
Per Request and Order to Correct  submitted on 6/28/16.  Court signed on 6/30/2016.

Back to Court.

records.addlTxt:
Deputy clerk received telephone call from court reporter of record for the plea hearing on September 23, 2015.  
She has reviewed the transcript; Judge Brash did give defendant felony restrictions/warnings at the time of the plea.

A review of the CCAP record does not indicate whether defendant was given restrictions as to voting and firearms.
On June 10, 2016 deputy clerk contacted court reporter of record for the plea hearing on September 23, 2015; to request a review of the transcript as to whether restrictions were given to defendant.
Clerk:  jms

Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court will grant expungement if there are no further violations of the law and upon successful completion of the probation sentence.  Court finds that expungement would not be appropriate if significant and regular payments are not made to satisfy the restitution ordered.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant.  

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  36  months;  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  15  months;  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  21 months. 
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  42  months.

Court finds defendant is  NOT  eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is  NOT elgible for the Substance abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
-  Serve 75  days in the House of Correction.  Condition time is stayed to 5:00 p.m. on June 13, 2016
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with the WalMart retail store at 4140 West Greenfield Avenue, Village of West Milwaukee
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $19,936
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $19,936 to WalMart during the term of probation.  Agent can set up a payment plan.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
-  Full-time employment or part-time employment and school or full-time school
-  No Contact Order with the WalMart retail store at 4140 West Greenfield Avenue, Village of West Milwaukee
-  Court sets Restitution in the amount of $19,936
-  Pay Restitution in the amount of $19,936 to WalMart during the term of extended supervision.  Agent can set up a payment plan.  Restitution to be paid before costs, fees, assessments and surcharges.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Costs, fees, assessments and surcharges to be paid after restitution has been satisfied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
if confinement is served -  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgment received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
submitted to the court by defense counsel as to sentencing.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not proceed to sentencing on today's date due to court calendar congestion.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case could not proceed to sentencing on today's date as court is in trial on an unrelated case.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms
Error in the classification of the amended charge listing amendment to a Class A Misdemeanor.  Correction made to properly reflect charge was amended from a Class G Felony to a Class H Felony.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 18, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with Attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel is making his first appearance as to this case; Atty. V. Taylor is no longer with the Public Defender's office.
Defense counsel is requesting adjournment of today's scheduled sentencing hearing.

Discussion on the record with the parties:
State informs that negotiations were if the defendant failed to bring restitution to court the original charge can be reinstated.

Furthermore, State informs that the CCAP entry regarding the amended charge and the subsequent plea hearing is in error - the charge was amended to a lesser felony.  The CCAP entry indicates the charge was amended to a misdemeanor.

Court grants defense counsel motion for adjournment and orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court in trial.  Parties are advised that effective December 14, 2015, this case will be assigned to Judge Sanders presiding in Branch 28 in room 629 of the Courthouse.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant changes plea to GUILTY to the amended charge.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty on the amended charge as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant needs to provide documentation that she has paid restitution.  Matter adjourned for sentencing.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Amended Information changing the original charge from a Class G Felony to a Class H Felony received and filed.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 10, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense unable to proceed and requests an adjornment of the plea hearing.  Plea hearing scheduled for September 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Defense requests projected guilty plea date.  Case remains calendared in Branch 21.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference conducted.  Defense waiting for an offer from the State.  Status conference scheduled for July 7, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Chakula A Moore in court with attorney Valeria Lenise Taylor.  Michael Jerome Lonski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound Defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.  Original Information received and filed.  Copy given to Defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant was arraigned in open court and Court entered a not guilty plea on behalf of the defendant. Court ordered case adjourned for Scheduling Conference in Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 05-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.
